measured_by: Block-Marschak Inequalities (BMI) test on forced-choice lineup probabilities
justification: The paper explains that the “Block-Marschak inequalities … could be used as a test of random-scale representation” and reports applying “the Block-Marschak inequalities test for random-scale … representation.”

measured_by: Block-Marschak Inequalities test with monotonic-likelihood constraints
justification: Authors state that model fits were re-evaluated “when monotonic-likelihood constraints were tested together with the BMIs,” showing the same procedure operationalised the monotonic-likelihood construct.

measured_by: Monotonic hazard-function test of target ranking data
justification: They note “a critical test of HT representation—monotonic hazards for second and subsequent choices… When applied to the empirical ranking data … the HT model was shown to be false,” indicating hazards of ranking data served as the HT test.

measured_by: Discriminability parameter (δ) of the Unequal-Variance Signal Detection Theory (UV-SDT) model
justification: The manuscript states that formal models must include parameters representing "eyewitness discriminability" and later that constraining the UV-SDT model showed “its parameters … align very well with the psychological construct of discriminability.”

measured_by: Decision criterion parameters (c) within the UV-SDT model
justification: The authors emphasise models need parameters for “decision bias” and during analysis they “allowed the criterion parameters to vary freely … thus confirming the link between the UV-SDT model’s criterion parameters and the psychological construct of … decision bias.”

measured_by: Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve of correct (CID) vs false (FID) identifications
justification: The study presents “the ROC-space illustrating the observed correct identification rate (CID)-false identification rate (FID) pairs,” using ROC analysis as the instrument for measuring identification accuracy.
